title: Executive Order 6891-Revocation in Part of Executive Order No. 6065, of March 3, 1933, Reserving Public Lands
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910 (ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497), it is ordered that Executive Order No. 6065, dated March 3, 1933, reserving certain lands in Arizona and Nevada as the Boulder Canyon Wild Life Refuge, be, and it is hereby, revoked insofar as it affects the following-described land in Arizona:
T. 30 N., R. 22 W., unsurveyed, which will probably be, when surveyed, SW¼ sec. 5, SE¼ sec. 6, NE¼ sec. 7, and NW¼ sec. 8, approximately 640 acres.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6891-Revocation in Part of Executive Order No. 6065, of March 3, 1933, Reserving Public Lands Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/373427
